topic.para: On servers where logs of many clients are retained for extended periods of time, log files are usually stored under a directory hierarchy. To help sort incoming log messages to such hierarchies, syslog-ng supports the use of macros. Depending on the needs of your organization, date, source host, or combined solutions can be used.

In the following example, the file destination on the server is modified to also write messages into a directory structure under /var/log, where the first level is the year, the second level is the week of the year, followed by a file name based on the sending host.
